word: In the days of Noah, the wickedness of the world became so great that God could no longer bear with it; and He said, "I will destroy man whom I have created from the face of the earth" (Genesis 6:7). But He pitied the race, and in His love provided a refuge for all who would accept it. He gave the message to Noah to be given to the people: "My spirit shall not always strive with man" (verse 3).
